definitions.definition: expected to do something or to become something

examples.text: I had a phone call from a prospective client today.
They are worried about prospective changes in the law.
On learning of a prospective sale, the lawyer should call the client as soon as possible.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (in the sense ‘looking forward, having foresight’): from obsolete French prospectif, -ive or late Latin prospectivus, from Latin prospectus ‘view’, from prospicere ‘look forward’, from pro- ‘forward’ + specere ‘to look’.
